solution_line_template: Bowen bought {more_pencils_fraction} * {pens_bought} pens = <<{more_pencils_fraction}*{pens_bought}={more_pencils}>>{more_pencils} more pencils than pens.
The total number of pencils that he bought is {initial_pencils_base} pencils + {more_pencils} pencils = <<{initial_pencils_base}+{more_pencils}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} pencils

If each pencil costs twenty-five cents, the total amount of money he spent on pencils is {total_pencils} pencils * ${pencil_cost_dollars}/pencil = $<<{total_pencils}*{pencil_cost_dollars}={cost_pencils}>>{cost_pencils}
The total amount of money Bowen spent is ${cost_pencils} + ${cost_pens} = $<<{cost_pencils}+{cost_pens}={total_money_spent}>>{total_money_spent}
